intro: Psychotria calocardia, commonly known as the "Coca flower" or "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in humid, shaded environments at higher elevations. The plant has been historically used by indigenous communities for its psychoactive properties.
